author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: لَمْ أَدْرِ يا إِلهِي أَيَّ نارٍ جَعَلْتَها مُشْتَعِلَةً فِي أَرْضِكَ بِحَيْثُ لا يَسْتُرُها التُّرابُ وَلا يُخْمِدُها المِياهُ وَلا يَمْنَعُها مَنْ عَلَى الأَرْضِ كُ
translation: I know not, O my God, what the Fire is which Thou didst kindle in Thy land. Earth can never cloud its splendor, nor water quench its flame. All the peoples of the world are powerless to resist its force. Great is the blessedness of him that hath drawn nigh unto it, and heard its roaring.
